definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: In your case, we are prepared to be lenient .
sentences.chinese: 根據你的情況，我們擬予以從寬處理。

sentences.english: In your case, we are prepared to be lenient.
sentences.chinese: 根據你的情況，我們擬予從寬處理。

sentences.english: The judge promised leniency if the offender confessed.
sentences.chinese: 如果罪犯認罪，法官答應從寬發落。

sentences.english: They’re making a ton of money off of broadband service.
sentences.chinese: 他們正從寬帶業務中收取大筆大筆的錢款。

sentences.english: They'll probably go easy on him since he hasn't been in trouble before.
sentences.chinese: 他們可能會對他從寬處理，因爲他以前沒惹過麻煩。

sentences.english: Styles have become more varied, from broadly cartoonish to almost photo-realistic.
sentences.chinese: 風格更爲多樣，從寬廣的卡通風格到幾乎與照片亂真。

sentences.english: The man pleaded guilty and threw him self on the mercy of the court.
sentences.chinese: 那個男人服罪，請求法庭從寬處理。

sentences.english: First time offenders can expect leniency whereas repeat offenders can expect severe punishment.
sentences.chinese: 初犯會從寬處理，而慣犯會受到嚴厲的懲罰。

sentences.english: It was his youth and inexperience that got him off.
sentences.chinese: 他因年幼無知而受到從寬處理。

sentences.english: The king was very lenient towards his error, and decided to give him the lightest punishment.
sentences.chinese: 國王對他的錯誤網開三面，決定從寬發落。

sentences.english: The court let the criminal off with a light sentence because he had made a fairly honest confession.
sentences.chinese: 法院從寬發落了這個罪犯，因爲他坦白得比較徹底。

sentences.english: Up to Olympus from the wide-spread earth.
sentences.chinese: 從寬廣的大地飛向奧林匹斯山。
